elementSpec.desc: contains the incipit of a manuscript item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipts were, in fomer times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title.

attDef.desc: indicates whether the incipit as given is defective, i.e. the first words of the text as preserved, as opposed to the first words of the work itself.

egXML.incipit: Pater noster qui es in celis
Ghif ons huden onse dagelix broet
Ideo dicit firmiter quia ordo fidei nostre probari non potest
